Package com.example.recipeoop_1.security

Class JwtRequestFilter

java.lang.Object
org.springframework.web.filter.GenericFilterBean
org.springframework.web.filter.OncePerRequestFilter
com.example.recipeoop_1.security.JwtRequestFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
jakarta.servlet.Filter, org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanNameAware, org.springframework.beans.factory.DisposableBean, org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, org.springframework.context.EnvironmentAware, org.springframework.core.env.EnvironmentCapable, org.springframework.web.context.ServletContextAware
@Component public class JwtRequestFilter extends org.springframework.web.filter.OncePerRequestFilter
A Spring Security filter that intercepts incoming HTTP requests to validate JWT tokens.

This filter extends OncePerRequestFilter to ensure it's executed once per request. It checks for a JWT token in the "Authorization" header of the request. If a valid token is found, it authenticates the user and sets the Authentication object in the SecurityContextHolder. This allows subsequent parts of the application (e.g., secured controller methods) to access the authenticated user's details.

Since:
2025-05-14

  • Constructor Details

    • JwtRequestFilter

      @Autowired public JwtRequestFilter(@Lazy @Qualifier("jwtUserDetailsService") org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService userDetailsService, JwtTokenUtil jwtTokenUtil)
      Constructs a JwtRequestFilter with necessary dependencies.

      The UserDetailsService is injected with Lazy annotation to help break potential circular dependencies that can occur in Spring Security configurations, particularly when WebSecurityConfig and UserDetailsService implementations might reference each other indirectly.

      Parameters:
      userDetailsService - The service (qualified as "jwtUserDetailsService") used to load user-specific data.
      jwtTokenUtil - The utility class for JWT token generation and validation.

  • Method Details

    • shouldNotFilter

      protected boolean shouldNotFilter(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Determines whether this filter should not be applied to the given request.

      This implementation skips filtering for paths related to authentication (e.g., "/api/auth/") and, currently, paths related to Swagger API documentation.

      Note: If Swagger is being removed from the project, the paths /swagger-ui/, /api-docs/, and /v3/api-docs/ should also be removed from this condition.

      Overrides:
      shouldNotFilter in class org.springframework.web.filter.OncePerRequestFilter
      Parameters:
      request - The current HTTP request.
      Returns:
      true if the filter should not be applied, false otherwise.

    • doFilterInternal

      protected void doFilterInternal(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response, jakarta.servlet.FilterChain chain) throws jakarta.servlet.ServletException, IOException
      Performs the core filtering logic for JWT validation and authentication.

      This method is called for each request that is not excluded by shouldNotFilter(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest). It attempts to extract a JWT token from the "Authorization" header. If a token is found, it's validated. If valid, the user's details are loaded, and an authentication token is created and set in the SecurityContextHolder.

      Specified by:
      doFilterInternal in class org.springframework.web.filter.OncePerRequestFilter
      Parameters:
      request - The HttpServletRequest.
      response - The HttpServletResponse.
      chain - The FilterChain to pass the request and response to the next filter.
      Throws:
      jakarta.servlet.ServletException - if a servlet-specific error occurs.
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
